titleStmt.title: The penitant traytor or the humble confession of a Devonshire gentleman, who was condemned for high treason, and executed at Tyborne for the same, in the raigne of King Henry the third, the ninteenth of July, 1267. You may sing this if you please. To the tune of, Fortune my foe.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Attend good Christian people to my story,"...
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
